data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3243617,"name":"Ryan Hubbs","username":"ryanhubbs","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryanhubbs/{size}/231107_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-21T16:06:05.268Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe have a tshirt cannon that uses FRC parts to control 6 solenoids for firing out of 6 separate barrels. Our current compressor is getting some issues and we’re wanting to replace it, but I’m not sure exactly which compressor would be good for this. We will have it mounted on our cannon and it will have to run for a while at a time with some breaks in between.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-10-21T16:06:05.268Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":40,"reads":267,"readers_count":266,"score":253.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":442832,"topic_slug":"recommended-tshirt-cannon-compressor","display_username":"Ryan Hubbs","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53872,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2152 | FIRST in FL | MoSim"},"post_url":"/t/recommended-tshirt-cannon-compressor/442832/1","custom_user_title":"2152 | FIRST in FL | MoSim","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3243621,"name":"Roman A.","username":"RomanTechPlus","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/romantechplus/{size}/214929_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-21T16:14:15.995Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHonestly, if you can, id recommend looking into scuba tank storage. Our cannon is set up to go for basicly an entire year without a refill, and its ready instantly for every event. Simons, 5406","username":"nuclearnerd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuclearnerd/{size}/7324_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-23T18:27:14.908Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe found pretty quickly that even a 120V 10A compressor (powered through an inverter) can’t keep up with a t-shirt cannon after a few shots.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eInstead, we switched to a 10lb CO2 tank which you can get filled and tested at a homebrew supply or fire protection equipment store.  Liquified CO2 has its own issues (the valves can freeze up, and you need an appropriate regulator), but you should get ~100 shots per tank.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-10-23T18:27:47.477Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":102,"readers_count":101,"score":20.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":442832,"topic_slug":"recommended-tshirt-cannon-compressor","display_username":"Brendan Simons, 5406","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22221,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/recommended-tshirt-cannon-compressor/442832/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3244700,"name":"fargus111111111","username":"fargus111111111","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fargus111111111/{size}/234737_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-24T19:05:32.375Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003e343’s old tshirt shooter uses a pair of the old diaphram style compressors from the dinosaur days of FRC and had a very large (for an FRC robot) air tank on board, 1.5gal maybe.
